item.title: Gerald add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Nancy M. Malone
item.description: "You do what you were made to do. Some of us were made to read and write. Thanks be to God." -- Nancy M. Malone

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "An American is insubmissive, lonely, self-educated, and polite." -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "All happiness depends on courage and work." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Karen Elizabeth Gordon
item.description: "All phone calls are obscene." -- Karen Elizabeth Gordon

item.title: Gerald add a quote by George F. Will
item.description: "The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised." -- George F. Will

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There is creative reading as well as creative writing." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "The written word, obviously, is very inward, and when we're reading, we're thinking. It's a sort of spiritual, meditative activity. When we're looking at visual objects, I think our eyes are obviously directed outward, so there's not as much reflective time. And it's the reflectiveness and the spiritual inwardness about reading that appeals to me." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "Absolute faith corrupts as absolutely as absolute power." -- Eric Hoffer

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not." -- Eric Hoffer

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "Writing is the only profession where no one considers you ridiculous if you earn no money." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Gerald add a quote by G.M. Trevelyan
item.description: "Education... has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading. a" -- G.M. Trevelyan

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Gerald add a quote by William Henry Channing
item.description: "To live content with small means; to seek elegance rather than luxury, and refinement rather than fashion, to be worthy, not respectable, and wealthy, not rich; to study hard, think quietly, talk gently, act frankly, to listen to stars and birds, to babes and sages, with open heart, to bear all cheerfully, to all bravely await occasions, hurry never. In a word, to let the spiritual unbidden and unconscious grow up through the common. This is to be my symphony." -- William Henry Channing

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Dorothy Bryant
item.description: "A novel is more a symphony, opera, oratorio. It exists in time, it goes by you a sound dying out as you write on, so that it is very hard to keep in touch with the whole thing..." -- Dorothy Bryant

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Judy Garland
item.description: "Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else." -- Judy Garland

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Gerald add a quote by Adlai E. Stevenson
item.description: "It's hard to lead a cavalry charge if you think you look funny on a horse." -- Adlai E. Stevenson
